intro: Psoralea brachystachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or bean family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with slender stems and small, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to brownish, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Psoralea brachystachya is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
